data.text:
Best Movies

She won the Golden Globe Award for Best Ensemble Cast, a Venice Film Festival Volpi Cup Award for Best Ensemble Cast and a National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Supporting Actress for her role as Sherri Shepard in comedy drama film Short Cuts (1993).

She was nominated for the Saturn Award for Best Actress for her performance as Kathryn Railly in science fiction movie 12 Monkeys (1995).

She was nominated for a Blockbuster Entertainment Award for Favorite Supporting Actress - Suspense and the ALMA Award for Outstanding Actress in a Feature Film for her role as Warr. Off. Sara Sunhill in mystery thriller film The General's Daughter (1999).

She won the American Veterans Center Award for Best Actress for her performance as Julia Moore in war movie We Were Soldiers (2002).

She won the Imagen Award for Best Actress for her role as Milly Martinez in drama film Saving Milly (2005).

The Last of the Mohicans (1992) epic historical drama as Cora Munro

We Were Soldiers (2002) war action as Julia Moore

Unlawful Entry (1992) psychological thriller as Karen Carr

The Two Jakes (1990) neo-noir mystery as Lillian Bodine

Impostor (2002) science fiction psychological thriller as Maya Olham

Bad Girls (1994) Western adventure as Cody Zamora

China Moon (1994) romantic thriller as Rachel Munro

The Christmas Hope (2009) drama as Patricia Addison

Best TV Shows

She was nominated for the Golden Globe Award for Best Actress â Television Series Drama for her role as Victoria Grayson in ABC drama television series Revenge (2011â2015).

Beulah Land (1980) NBC miniseries as Selma Kendrick Davis

The Gangster Chronicles (1981) crime drama miniseries as Ruth Lasker

Raines (2005) police procedural television show as Dr. Samantha Kohl

Soundtrack (2019) Netflix musical drama series as Margot Weston

Facts

She started practicing for a career as a concert pianist, at the age of 10.

Has brother, Robert and sister, Diane.

Has Dutch, German and English ancestry.

She is also trained in Taekwondo, Tai Chi Chuan, Kickboxing and Judo.

She is on the Board of Directors of foundation, Artists for Peace and Justice.

She won the Keck School of Medicine of USC Humanitarian Award in 2014.

Lives in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles, California.

Relationships

She married actor Brian Benben in 1982, they have a daughter, May Theodora.
